fields_of_interest: Agriculture, Consumers, Environment, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Food Safety
eu_initiatives:
IZSLT experts participate in the drafting of secondary legislation such as implementing and delegated acts in the frame of FVE expert groups involved in about Veterinary and Food Safety EU Legislation on: 
-Regulation (EU) 2017/625 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 15 March 2017 on official controls and other official activities.... 
-Regulation (EU) 2016/429 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 9 March 2016 on transmissible animal diseases and amending and repealing certain acts in the area of animal health (‘Animal Health Law’)  
 
Drafting delegated and implementing acts of EU legislation on Antimicrobial Resistance and Genetic Modified Organisms controls. 
The initiatives followed by the NRL for GMOs within the European Network of GMO Laboratories are: 
-Definition of minimum performance requirements for analytical methods of GMO testing  
-Technical guidance document from the European Union Reference Laboratory for Genetically Modified Food and Feed on the implementation of Commission Regulation (EU) NO 619/2011  
-Participation in the ad hoc Advisory Group for consideration and Selection of Methods for Validation and standing working group on Update of Methods (SWG-UpMeth), participation in the Working Group Digital PCR 
-Verification of analytical methods for GMO testing when implementing inter laboratory validated methods 
-Working Group on procedures 
 
The NRL for GMOs also follows the Guidance Document on Measurement Uncertainty for GMO Testing Laboratories within the Joint Research Centre.  
The NRL for GMOs is Member of the Permanent Commitment for Plants, Animals, Food and Feed, Genetically Modified Food and Feed Section, member of the Working Group GM Food & Feed of the European Commission and participates in the ENGL Steering Committee meetings within the European Commission, Joint Research Centre, Institute for Health and Consumer Protection, Molecular Biology and Genomics Unit, Ispra (VA) 
Regarding the National Reference Laboratory for Antimicrobial Resistance pursuant to Article 33 of Regulation (EC) 882/2004, the focus of NRL work is on recording comparable data on antibiotic resistance in zoonotic agents and other pathogens to the extent that they present a hazard to public and animal health. The results are regularly compiled in the annual zoonosis report which is prepared for Italy pursuant to Article 9 of Directive 2003/99/EC and passed on to the European Food Safety Authority (EFSA). EU dossiers influenced by its results are the EU policies on proper and prudent use of drugs and  antimicrobials in livestock and pet animals. Issuing of Italian Veterinary Antimicrobial Resistance Monitoring, annual report. 
Drafting of guidelines on microbiological criteria for categorization of areas in bivalve molluscs harvesting.  
On behalf of the National Ministry of Health, IZSLT participates in collaborative Work Group on Animal Health and Welfare for the development and updating of strategic research agenda. 
On behalf of the National Ministry of Health, IZSLT holds membership in the International Research Consortium on Animal Health for development of EU research policy by DG Research and in the WG 19 on microbiological challenge test in the ISO organization.
organisation_name: Istituto Zooprofilattico Sperimentale del Lazio e della Toscana M. Aleandri (IZSLT)
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
membership:
Collaborazione con l'OIE per il programma di ricerca  “Advancing efforts to address challenges related to One health and Food Security”,  tra Ministero della Salute, IIZZSS e l’OIE: http://www.izslt.it/blog/tag/oie/ 
 
Agenzia per la Ricerca Europea (National Contact Ppoint) - APRE - www.apre.it
position: Responsabile Ricerca, Sviluppo e Cooperazione Internazionale
relevant_communication:
Participation in CASA (Common Agricultural and wider bioeconomy reSearch Agenda) H2020 CSA Project, supporting the research planning activities of SCAR (Standing Committee on Agricultural Research). 
Participation in SusAn (European Research Area on Sustainable Animal Production Systems) H2020 Era-Net project for the development of EU research policies on Sustainable Animal Productions. 
Our institutional mission provides laboratory diagnostic, epidemiological surveillance and professional training in the frame of REG. EU 625/2017 and REG. EU 2016/429. 
Through its NRLs, IZSLT provides when necessary clear rules to establish what the method to be used for laboratory analyses related to Official activities, as stated at comma 47 of the REG. EU 625/2017. 
IZSLT is accredited for the use of the necessary methods to fulfill its tasks according to standard EN ISO/IEC 17025 on ‘General requirements for the competence of testing and calibration laboratories’ (comma 50 Reg. EU 625/2017). 
Active participation in inter-laboratory comparative tests and training courses for national reference laboratories or official laboratories (comma 71 REG. EU 625/2017). 
IZSLT, as an official laboratory, inform immediately the competent authorities which designated them about the relevant results for the analysis, test or diagnosis carried out as defined in the article 38 REG. EU 625/2017. 
The national reference laboratories present at IZSLT follow duly the article 101 of the REG. CE 2017/625 “Responsibilities and tasks of national reference laboratories”, carrying also in this context epidemiological surveillance as specified also in the art 25 of the same regulation. 
The national reference laboratories present at IZSLT follow the training courses for national reference laboratories and official laboratories offered at EU level and by the European Reference Laboratory, following the directives regarding staff training specified in the REG. CE 2017/625. IZSLT follows the points of the Annex II of the REG. CE 2017/625 regarding the training of its staff. 
The national reference laboratories follow duly the responsibilities and tasks defined in the Article 101 of the REG. CE 2017/625  
IZSLT follows proper biosecurity measures as specified in the Article 16 of the REG. CE 2016/429 “Obligations of laboratories, facilities and others handling disease agents, vaccines and other biological products”. 
IZSLT as an Official Animal Health Laboratory, taking into account the presence of National Reference Laboratories within it, cooperate within a network of Union animal health laboratories under the coordination of the Union reference laboratories regarding disease-related issues (REG. CE 2016/429 Article 17) and disease notification (REG. CE 2016/429 Article 18) 
IZSLT as an Official Animal Health Laboratory carries out examinations to confirm or rule out the presence of listed diseases under Investigation by the competent authority in the event of suspicion of a listed disease (REG. CE 2016/429 Article 54) and provide laboratory examinations when required by the Competent Authority as required in the Article 61, contributing to the investigation by the competent authority (Article 73 of the REG. CE 2016/429). 
IZSLT provides epidemiological surveillance contributing to what established in Article 57 of the REG. CE 2016/429. 
Scientific publication: 
Messori, S., Zilli, R., Mariano, V., Bagni, M.  (2017) FORE-Med - the development of a foresight methodology for the prioritisation of animal health research in the Mediterranean area up to 2030 [FORE-Med - sviluppo e realizzazione di uno studio previsionale per priorizzare le necessità di ricerca in sanità animale nella regione Mediterranea fino al 2030]. Veterinaria Italiana, 53(1), pp. 71-83 
 
Istitutional report:  
Sustaining training missions on bivalve mollusk legislation applicability.
